answers.answer: Primary replicas contain the original data and handle read requests, while secondary replicas are only used for backup purposes.
Primary replicas store the primary copy of the data and manage write operations, while secondary replicas are read-only copies used for read load balancing.
Primary replicas handle indexing and search operations, while secondary replicas serve as failover backups in case the primary node fails.
Primary replicas are responsible for data durability and manage write operations, while secondary replicas are used for distributed search and scale-out purposes.
